original_solution_mapping.L1: He has enough milk to make 18 milkshakes because 72 / 4 = <<72/4=18>>18
original_solution_mapping.L2: He has enough ice cream to make 16 milkshakes because 192 / 12 = <<192/12=16>>16
original_solution_mapping.L3: He can only make 16 milkshakes because 16 < 18
original_solution_mapping.L4: He will use 64 ounces of milk because 16 x 4 = <<16*4=64>>64
original_solution_mapping.L5: He will have 8 ounces of milk left because 72 - 64 = <<72-64=8>>8

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6340.
    Returns: the amount of milk left over.
    """
    # L1
    total_milk_ounces = 72 # 72 ounces of milk
    milk_per_milkshake = 4 # 4 ounces of milk
    milkshakes_from_milk = total_milk_ounces / milk_per_milkshake

    # L2
    total_ice_cream_ounces = 192 # 192 ounces of ice cream
    ice_cream_per_milkshake = 12 # 12 ounces of ice cream
    milkshakes_from_ice_cream = total_ice_cream_ounces / ice_cream_per_milkshake

    # L3
    actual_milkshakes_made = min(milkshakes_from_milk, milkshakes_from_ice_cream)

    # L4
    milk_used = actual_milkshakes_made * milk_per_milkshake

    # L5
    milk_left_over = total_milk_ounces - milk_used

    # FA
    answer = milk_left_over
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He has enough milk to make {milkshakes_from_milk} milkshakes because {total_milk_ounces} / {milk_per_milkshake} = <<{total_milk_ounces}/{milk_per_milkshake}={milkshakes_from_milk}>>{milkshakes_from_milk}

He has enough ice cream to make {milkshakes_from_ice_cream} milkshakes because {total_ice_cream_ounces} / {ice_cream_per_milkshake} = <<{total_ice_cream_ounces}/{ice_cream_per_milkshake}={milkshakes_from_ice_cream}>>{milkshakes_from_ice_cream}
He can only make {actual_milkshakes_made} milkshakes because {milkshakes_from_ice_cream} < {milkshakes_from_milk}
He will use {milk_used} ounces of milk because {actual_milkshakes_made} x {milk_per_milkshake} = <<{actual_milkshakes_made}*{milk_per_milkshake}={milk_used}>>{milk_used}
He will have {milk_left_over} ounces of milk left because {total_milk_ounces} - {milk_used} = <<{total_milk_ounces}-{milk_used}={milk_left_over}>>{milk_left_over}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He has enough milk to make 18 milkshakes because 72 / 4 = <<72/4=18>>18
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He has enough ice cream to make 16 milkshakes because 192 / 12 = <<192/12=16>>16
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: He can only make 16 milkshakes because 16 < 18
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: He will use 64 ounces of milk because 16 x 4 = <<16*4=64>>64
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: He will have 56 ounces of milk left because 72 - 16 = <<72-16=56>>56

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'actual_milkshakes_made' (value: 16.0) was used instead of 'milk_used' (value: 64.0).
